topic_metadata.title: How to do conditional show rule on math.accent to replace hat(i) with hat(dotless.i)?

posts.cooked:
I’ve tried to do a where selector on math.accent to select only hat(i), but I can’t seem to get it to work. Here is my current show rule that doesn’t end up working.

#show math.accent.where(base: [i], accent: math.hat): math.accent(math.dotless.i, math.hat)

$ hat(i) == accent(i, hat) != hat(dotless.i) $
posts.raw:
I've tried to do a `where` selector on `math.accent` to select only `hat(i)`, but I can't seem to get it to work. Here is my current `show` rule that doesn't end up working.
```typ
#show math.accent.where(base: [i], accent: math.hat): math.accent(math.dotless.i, math.hat)

$ hat(i) == accent(i, hat) != hat(dotless.i) $
```

posts.cooked: So just found out after compiling to pdf with Typst 0.13 that this is a bug in either the TypstPreview plugin for Neovim or in Typst 0.12, but it works in Typst 0.13.
posts.raw: So just found out after compiling to pdf with Typst 0.13 that this is a bug in either the TypstPreview plugin for Neovim or in Typst 0.12, but it works in Typst 0.13.
